defs:
1.(ditransitive) to give; 2.(with a ou para or an indirect objective pronoun); 3.to transfer one’s possession of something to someone without anything in return
Dar-te-ei um livro. / Te darei um livro.I will give you a book.; 4.to hand over (to pass something into someone’s hand); 5.to make a present or gift of
Dei flores à minha mulher.I gave my wife flowers.; 6.to provide a service
A Igreja dá conforto aos pobres.The Church gives the poor comfort.; 7.to administer (to cause to take (medicine)); 8.(transitive) to give; to issue; to emit; 9.(with the indirect object taking em or an indirect objective pronoun); 10.to carry out a physical interaction with something
Ela me deu um beijo. / Ela deu um beijo em mim.She gave me a kiss.; 11.to cause a sensation or feeling
A cerca me deu um choque elétrico.The fence gave me an electric shock.; 12.to cause (to produce as a result); 13.to yield; to produce; to generate; 14.(impersonal, transitive, followed by para when transitive) to be possible, to can; 15.(transitive) to throw (to organise an event); 16.(transitive with que; impersonal with em) to report (publish or broadcast news); 17.(transitive with em or with no preposition) to result in
Não te preocupes, não dará em nada.Don’t worry, it won’t lead to anything.; 18.(transitive or auxiliary with para and a verb in the personal infinitive) to suffice, to be enough
Dez euros dá para almoçar hoje.Ten euros is enough to have lunch today.; 19.(transitive) to make (to tend or be able to become); 20.(ditransitive, with the indirect object taking por or como) to consider (assign some quality to); 21.(transitive with com) to come across (to find something accidentally or in an unexpected condition); 22.(Brazil, vulgar, slang, intransitive, or ditransitive, with the indirect object taking para) to put out, to allow to be sexually penetrated; 23.(Brazil, slang, transitive with de) to defeat by a given score
Meu time vai dar de dois a zero no seu.My team will beat yours 2-nil.;
examples: 1. (with a ou para or an indirect objective pronoun)
1. to transfer one’s possession of something to someone without anything in return
1. Dar-te-ei um livro. / Te darei um livro.I will give you a book.
1. Synonym: ceder
1. Antonym: receber
1. to hand over (to pass something into someone’s hand)
1. Dá-me tua mão. / Me dá sua mão.Give me your hand.
1. Synonyms: entregar, passar
1. to make a present or gift of
1. Dei flores à minha mulher.I gave my wife flowers.
1. Synonym: presentear
1. Antonyms: ganhar, receber
1. to provide a service
1. A Igreja dá conforto aos pobres.The Church gives the poor comfort.
1. Ele dá aulas de latim.He gives Latin classes.
1. Synonym: oferecer
1. to administer (to cause to take (medicine))
1. Demo-lo insulina. / Demos insulina a ele.We gave him insulin.
1. Synonym: administrar
1. (transitive) to give; to issue; to emit
1. João nos dará recomendações.John will give us recommendations.
1. Ele gosta de dar ordens.He likes issuing orders.
1. (with the indirect object taking em or an indirect objective pronoun)
1. to carry out a physical interaction with something
1. Ela me deu um beijo. / Ela deu um beijo em mim.She gave me a kiss.
1. Dá uma tijolada nele.Give him a blow with a brick.
1. to cause a sensation or feeling
1. A cerca me deu um choque elétrico.The fence gave me an electric shock.
1. Essa música me dá medo.This song frightens me. (Literally: This song gives me fear.)
1. to cause (to produce as a result)
1. Comer rápido dá azia em você. / Comer rápido te dá azia.Eating quickly gives you a heartburn.
1. to yield; to produce; to generate
1. Esse poço dava água.This well used to produce water.
1. Macieiras dão maçãs.Apple trees produce apples.

13. Esse poço dava água.This well used to produce water.
13. Macieiras dão maçãs.Apple trees produce apples.
14. Não dá pra ele fazer isso.He can't do that.
14. – Dá para o alcançarmos?– Dá.– Can we reach him?– Yes, we can.
15. Darei uma festa para meus amigos amanhã.I’ll throw a party for my friends tomorrow.
16. O jornal deu que se cancelaram os eventos. / Deu no jornal que se cancelaram os eventos.The newspaper reported that the events had been cancelled.
18. Synonym: bastar
19. Ela daria uma boa professora.She would make a good teacher.
20. Depois de semanas procurando, deram-nos como desaparecidos.After weeks of searching, they considered us to be missing.
20. Synonym: considerar
22. Dei pra ele.I put out for him.

1. (intransitive) to sleep; to be asleep (to rest in a state of reduced consciousness); 2. (intransitive) to fall asleep (to become asleep); 3. (transitive) to have a given type of sleep; 4. (figuratively, intransitive) to sleep (to be temporarily inactive); 5. (euphemistic, transitive with com) to sleep with (to have sex with); 6. (figuratively, transitive with com) to be constantly with
A memória da guerra dorme com o veterano. ― The memory of the war sleeps with the veteran.; 7. (poetic, intransitive) to be dead
Todos meus heróis dormem. ― All my heroes are dead.; 8. (informal, of a limb, intransitive) to fall asleep (to temporarily lose blood circulation); 9. (Brazil, slang, intransitive) not to notice a problem
O controlador dormiu e os aviões bateram. ― The controller didn’t pay attention and the aeroplanes collided.;
examples: 1. Quieto! Meu gato está dormindo. ― Be quiet! My cat is sleeping.
2. Demorou horas até que eu dormisse. ― Hours passed before I fell asleep.
3. Dormir uma soneca. ― To have a nap.
4. A célula dos terroristas está dormindo. ― The terrorist cell is asleep.
5. Peguei-a dormindo com um rapaz. ― I caught her sleeping with a boy.
8. Acordei no meio da noite e meu braço tinha dormido. ― I woke up in the middle of the night and my arm had fallen asleep.
